name: fire-mastery
description: Early humans learned to control and use fire for warmth, cooking, and protection.

name: agriculture-begins
description: Humans began cultivating crops in the Fertile Crescent, starting the Neolithic Revolution.

name: wheel-invented
description: The wheel was invented in Mesopotamia, revolutionizing transportation and machinery.

name: bronze-discovered
description: Humans discovered how to alloy copper and tin to create bronze tools and weapons.

name: iron-smelting
description: The ability to smelt iron ore transformed warfare and agriculture.

name: polynesian-expansion
description: Polynesian navigators began exploring and settling islands across the Pacific Ocean.

name: phoenician-circumnavigation
description: Phoenician sailors reportedly sailed around the entire African continent.

name: pythagoras-theorem
description: Pythagoras proved the mathematical relationship between sides of a right triangle.

name: herodotus-histories
description: The Greek historian documented cultures and lands across the known world.

name: alexander-india
description: Alexander the Great's conquests brought Greek knowledge to the Indian subcontinent.

name: archimedes-principle
description: Archimedes discovered the principle of buoyancy while taking a bath.

name: eratosthenes-earth
description: Eratosthenes accurately calculated the circumference of the Earth using shadows.

name: silk-road-opens
description: Trade routes connecting China to the Mediterranean were established.

name: paper-invented
description: Cai Lun standardized papermaking techniques in Han Dynasty China.

name: compass-invented
description: Chinese inventors created the first magnetic compass for navigation.

name: gunpowder-invented
description: Chinese alchemists accidentally discovered gunpowder while seeking immortality.

name: vikings-iceland
description: Norse explorers established permanent settlements on Iceland.

name: vikings-greenland
description: Erik the Red explored and colonized Greenland.

name: vikings-north-america
description: Leif Erikson became the first known European to reach North America.

name: marco-polo-journey
description: The Venetian explorer arrived at the court of Kublai Khan.

name: ibn-battuta-travels
description: The Moroccan explorer began a journey covering 75,000 miles across the Islamic world.

name: zheng-he-voyages
description: The Chinese admiral began massive naval expeditions across the Indian Ocean.

name: gutenberg-printing
description: Johannes Gutenberg invented movable type printing, revolutionizing knowledge sharing.

name: portuguese-cape-verde
description: Portuguese explorers discovered the uninhabited Cape Verde islands.

name: dias-cape-good-hope
friendly_name: Dias Rounds Cape of Good Hope
description: Bartolomeu Dias became the first European to sail around Africa's southern tip.

name: columbus-americas
description: Christopher Columbus landed in the Caribbean, beginning European exploration of the Americas.

name: vasco-da-gama-india
description: The Portuguese explorer found a sea route from Europe to India.

name: cabot-north-america
description: John Cabot explored the coast of North America for England.

name: cabral-brazil
description: Pedro Álvares Cabral claimed Brazil for Portugal.

name: balboa-pacific
description: Vasco Núñez de Balboa became the first European to see the Pacific Ocean from the Americas.

name: copernicus-heliocentric
description: Nicolaus Copernicus published his theory that Earth orbits the Sun.

name: magellan-circumnavigation
description: Magellan's expedition completed the first voyage around the world.

name: cartier-st-lawrence
description: Jacques Cartier explored the St. Lawrence River and claimed Canada for France.

name: microscope-invented
description: Dutch spectacle makers invented the first compound microscope.

name: telescope-invented
description: Hans Lippershey invented the first practical telescope in the Netherlands.

name: galileo-jupiter-moons
description: Galileo observed four moons orbiting Jupiter, supporting heliocentrism.

name: hudson-river
description: Henry Hudson explored the river later named after him while seeking a northwest passage.

name: harvey-circulation
description: William Harvey published his discovery of how blood circulates through the body.

name: tasman-australia
description: Abel Tasman became the first European to reach Tasmania and New Zealand.

name: newton-gravity
description: Isaac Newton developed his theory of universal gravitation.

name: leeuwenhoek-bacteria
description: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek observed bacteria through his microscope.

name: bering-strait
description: Vitus Bering proved that Asia and North America were separate continents.

name: linnaeus-taxonomy
description: Carl Linnaeus published his system for classifying living organisms.

name: cook-australia
description: Captain James Cook mapped the east coast of Australia and claimed it for Britain.

name: oxygen-discovered
description: Joseph Priestley and Carl Wilhelm Scheele independently discovered oxygen.

name: uranus-discovered
description: William Herschel discovered the seventh planet in our solar system.

name: vaccination-invented
description: Edward Jenner developed the first successful vaccine using cowpox.

name: rosetta-stone
description: French soldiers found the key to deciphering Egyptian hieroglyphics.

name: lewis-clark-expedition
description: The expedition explored the American West from the Mississippi to the Pacific.

name: electromagnetism-discovered
description: Hans Christian Ørsted discovered the relationship between electricity and magnetism.

name: hieroglyphics-decoded
description: Jean-François Champollion deciphered Egyptian hieroglyphics using the Rosetta Stone.

name: dinosaur-fossils
description: William Buckland described Megalosaurus, the first dinosaur to be scientifically named.

name: antarctica-sighted
description: Russian, British, and American expeditions first sighted the Antarctic continent.

name: neptune-discovered
description: Johann Galle observed Neptune based on mathematical predictions.

name: gorillas-discovered
description: Western scientists first described gorillas from specimens found in Africa.

name: source-of-nile
description: John Hanning Speke identified Lake Victoria as the source of the Nile.

name: darwin-evolution
description: Charles Darwin published his theory of evolution by natural selection.

name: pasteurization
description: Louis Pasteur developed the process to kill harmful microorganisms in food and drink.

name: mendel-genetics
description: Gregor Mendel published his laws of inheritance from pea plant experiments.

name: periodic-table
description: Dmitri Mendeleev organized elements into the periodic table.

name: troy-discovered
description: Heinrich Schliemann excavated the legendary city of Troy in Turkey.

name: telephone-invented
description: Alexander Graham Bell patented the first practical telephone.

name: lightbulb-invented
description: Thomas Edison developed a practical incandescent light bulb.

name: germ-theory
description: Louis Pasteur and Robert Koch established that microorganisms cause disease.

name: x-rays-discovered
description: Wilhelm Röntgen discovered X-rays, revolutionizing medical imaging.

name: radioactivity-discovered
description: Henri Becquerel discovered radioactivity in uranium.

name: electron-discovered
description: J.J. Thomson discovered the electron, the first subatomic particle.

name: radium-discovered
description: Marie and Pierre Curie discovered the radioactive element radium.

name: powered-flight
description: The Wright brothers achieved the first controlled, powered airplane flight.

name: special-relativity
description: Albert Einstein published his theory of special relativity.

name: north-pole-reached
description: Robert Peary claimed to be the first person to reach the North Pole.

name: machu-picchu-discovered
description: Hiram Bingham brought the ancient Inca citadel to worldwide attention.

name: south-pole-reached
description: Roald Amundsen led the first expedition to reach the South Pole.

name: continental-drift
description: Alfred Wegener proposed that continents move over geological time.

name: atomic-nucleus
description: Ernest Rutherford discovered that atoms have a dense central nucleus.

name: general-relativity
description: Albert Einstein published his theory of general relativity and gravity.

name: tutankhamun-tomb
description: Howard Carter discovered the nearly intact tomb of the Egyptian pharaoh.

name: insulin-discovered
description: Frederick Banting and Charles Best discovered insulin, saving millions of diabetics.

name: hubble-galaxies
description: Edwin Hubble proved that other galaxies exist beyond the Milky Way.

name: penicillin-discovered
description: Alexander Fleming discovered the first antibiotic by accident.

name: expanding-universe
description: Edwin Hubble discovered that the universe is expanding.

name: pluto-discovered
description: Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto at Lowell Observatory.

name: neutron-discovered
description: James Chadwick discovered the neutron in the atomic nucleus.

name: nuclear-fission
description: Otto Hahn and Fritz Strassmann discovered nuclear fission.

name: dead-sea-scrolls
description: Ancient Jewish manuscripts were found in caves near the Dead Sea.

name: dna-structure
description: Watson and Crick discovered the double helix structure of DNA.

name: everest-summited
description: Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay became the first to reach the summit.

name: polio-vaccine
description: Jonas Salk's vaccine was declared safe and effective against polio.

name: sputnik-launched
description: The Soviet Union launched the first artificial satellite into orbit.

name: mariana-trench
description: Jacques Piccard and Don Walsh descended to the deepest point on Earth.

name: first-human-space
description: Yuri Gagarin became the first human to travel to outer space.

name: moon-landing
description: Neil Armstrong became the first human to walk on the Moon.

name: lucy-discovered
description: Donald Johanson discovered the famous Australopithecus afarensis skeleton in Ethiopia.

name: smallpox-eradicated
description: The World Health Organization declared smallpox the first disease eradicated by humans.

name: hiv-identified
description: Scientists identified HIV as the virus causing AIDS.

name: titanic-wreck-found
description: Robert Ballard discovered the wreck of the Titanic on the ocean floor.

name: world-wide-web
description: Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web at CERN.

name: hubble-telescope-launched
description: NASA launched the space telescope that revolutionized astronomy.

name: first-exoplanet
description: Astronomers discovered the first planets orbiting a star outside our solar system.

name: dolly-sheep-cloned
description: Scientists created the first mammal cloned from an adult cell.

name: human-genome-completed
description: Scientists completed mapping the entire human genetic code.

name: higgs-boson
description: Scientists at CERN confirmed the existence of the Higgs boson particle.

name: gravitational-waves
description: LIGO detected gravitational waves, confirming Einstein's prediction.

name: black-hole-image
description: The Event Horizon Telescope captured the first image of a black hole.

name: james-webb-launched
description: NASA launched the most powerful space telescope ever built.
